title: About Me
text:
I‚Äôm originally from Manta Potrero, a small town in Paraguay. I began my agricultural career at the San Francisco Agricultural School in Cerrito, Paraguay. Since then, I have earned degrees from EARTH University in Costa Rica, UnADM in Mexico (On line), and Kansas State University in the United States. Along this journey, I have learned from and contributed to a variety of agricultural projects across regions.





Dissertation: ‚ÄúAssessing Phosphorus Management Strategies to Enhance Crop Production‚Äù
Graduate Certificate: Applied Statistics
Advisor: Dorivar Ruiz Diaz
Committee: Ganga Hettiarachchi, Nathan Nelson, Christopher Valh



Report title: ‚ÄúBayesian Model Averaging Approach to Improve Fertilizer Recommendations‚Äù
Advisor: Christopher Valh
Committee: Trevor Hefley, Josefina Lacasa, Dorivar Ruiz Diaz



Thesis: ‚ÄúEvaluating diagnostic tools for phosphorus and sulfur management in corn‚Äù
Advisor: Dorivar Ruiz Diaz
Committee: Ganga Hettiarachchi, Nathan Nelson, Christopher Valh



Thesis: ‚ÄúApplication of sulfur in wheat cultivation (Triticum aestivum): its importance for food security‚Äù
Advisor: Eber Quintana
Committee: Mariela Gonzalez, Brenda Santiago, Dafne Orosco



Graduation Project: ‚ÄúDevelopment of a mobile application for the design and sizing of biodigesters‚Äù
Advisor: Mildred Linkimer
Honors: Distinguished student, fourth-year; Best graduation project presentation



Tracks: Agricultural Production & Hospitality and Tourism













üéì Wageningen University & Research (via edX) ‚Äî Online

Professional Certificate in Data Science (2024)
Courses: R Basics ¬∑ Visualization ¬∑ Probability ¬∑ Inference and Modeling ¬∑ Productivity Tools ¬∑ Wrangling ¬∑ Linear Regression ¬∑ Machine Learning ¬∑ Capstone











üéì Wageningen University & Research (via edX) ‚Äî Online
Professional Certificate and XSeries in Food Security and Sustainability (2021)
Courses: Crop Production ¬∑ Food Access ¬∑ The Value of Systems Thinking



















üß™ Graduate Research Assistant (Jan 2021 ‚Äì Present)
- Led multidisciplinary research on phosphorus (P) and sulfur (S) management: calibration, residual P effects, long-term placement, and P & S interactions.
- Managed over 40 site-years with farmers and university fields; supervised interns and coordinated nutrient studies on corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum.
- Analyzed datasets and contributed to peer-reviewed publications and conference presentations.











üî¨ Research Assistant (Jul 2019 ‚Äì Dec 2020)
- Assisted with fertility trials, greenhouse experiments, and isotopic studies using ¬π‚ÅµN tracers.
- Managed sample processing and ensured data accuracy.
- Operated research equipment including planting and fertilizer application systems.














üêñ Production Intern (Ohio International Intern Program) (May 2018 ‚Äì Apr 2019)
- Supported daily swine production operations, health monitoring, and facility upkeep.
- Assisted with artificial insemination and farrowing, enhancing animal care protocols.
- Recorded growth data to support better farm management and animal welfare practices.












üåû Undergraduate Research Assistant, CIDER (Jan 2017 ‚Äì Dec 2017)
- Developed renewable energy projects: biodigesters, solar cooking, desalination, and pumping.
- Conducted biodigester research and organized outreach workshops.
- Collaborated on sustainable energy systems for rural communities.












‚òï Student Intern (SEPS Project) (Aug 2016 ‚Äì Dec 2016)
- Evaluated biodigester biosolids as fertilizer for coffee nurseries.
- Installed clean-energy systems and trained rural communities in their use.
- Designed and built gasification units for biochar and energy production.








2025‚Äìpresent ‚Ä¢ Member, ASA CSSA SSSA Graduate Student Committee
2024‚Äì2024 ‚Ä¢ Graduate Student Representative, College of Agriculture Committee on Planning
2023‚Äì2025 ‚Ä¢ GSC/SGA Liaison, Kansas State University
2023‚Äì2024 ‚Ä¢ Member, College of Ag Graduate Student Advisory Committee 2021‚Äì2024 ‚Ä¢ Spanish course instructor (Volunteer) ‚Äî UFM Community Learning Center 2023 ‚Ä¢ President, Agronomy Graduate Student Association (AGSA), K-State 2023 ‚Ä¢ Graduate Student Representative, Agronomy Course and Curriculum Committee, K-State
2023 ‚Ä¢ Student moderator, 78th SWCS International Annual Conference, Des Moines, IA
2023 ‚Ä¢ Vice-president, Soil and Water Conservation Society student chapter, K-State
2022 ‚Ä¢ Chair, Scientific Communication Committee, AGSA, K-State
2017 ‚Ä¢ Chair, Gastronomy Committee, EARTH Multicultural Fair, EARTH University
2015 ‚Ä¢ Member, Student Electoral Tribunal (TEE), EARTH University

title: Gustavo Roa
text:
I‚Äôm Gustavo Roa, a Ph.D.¬†candidate in Agronomy at Kansas State University, focusing on soil fertility and nutrient management. My research explores phosphorus and sulfur fertilizer strategies in corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum using field trials, greenhouse studies, and isotopic tracer techniques (¬π‚ÅµN). I complement my agronomic training with a strong foundation in applied statistics and data analysis.
Publications Digital Resources CV

Curriculum Vitae

title: Research & Teaching
text:
My research integrates field experimentation, greenhouse studies, and isotope tracer techniques to improve fertilizer recommendations and nutrient diagnostics in cropping systems. I work at the intersection of agronomy, soil chemistry, and data science to enhance phosphorus and sulfur use efficiency in corn, soybean, wheat, and sorghum systems in Kansas and beyond.










üìç >40 site-years
Multi-location field trials across Kansas.











üß™ ¬π‚ÅµN tracers
Fertilizer N recovery in greenhouse + field.











üßÆ Models
Bayesian, Mixed/GAMs, ML for diagnostics & recs.











üåæ Crops
Corn, soybean, wheat, sorghum.









Phosphorus managementSulfur nutrition & diagnostics¬π‚ÅµN isotopic tracersData science & modeling



Long-term P placement trials (18+ years)

Soil test calibration and critical level updates for corn

Plant tissue concentrations to support P recommendations




Corn response to S across multiple environments

S uptake, efficiency indices, and diagnostic tool validation

Integrating biomass, SPAD, NDVI, and tissue analysis




Greenhouse and field trials evaluating fertilizer N recovery

Partitioning N from soil, fertilizer, and atmospheric sources

Methodological advances and best practices




Bayesian statistics to improve fertilizer recommendations

ML for nutrient prediction; decision trees for recs

Mixed models and GAMs for long-term data

Sensitivity analyses in erosion modeling (RUSLE + GEE)
